levelled against him and the registration of this crime is a corollary of strained
relationship between the petitioner and the local leaders of ruling party. It is
submitted that, while going through the First Information Statement given by

the defacto complainant, it is seen that the ingredients of the offences
punishable u/ss. 74, 62 of 64, 127(2) and 332(b) of Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita are
absent in this case.

11. The magnitude of the offence alleged is grave. However, it is seen
from the report filed by the Investigating Officer that the CCTV footages were

(1) Petitioner/accused shall execute bail bond for Rs.50,000/-
(Rupees Fifty Thousand only) with two solvent sureties for
the like sum each to the satisfaction of the Judicial First
Class Magistrate Court-I, Attingal.

4
(2) Petitioner shall appear before the Investigating Officer on
every Monday between 10 a.m. and 12 noon for a period of
3 (three) months or till the final report is filed, whichever is
earlier.
(3) Petitioner shall not enter into the limits of the Police
Station, where the victim resides, except for complying
with the orders of this court, till the final report is filed.
(4) Petitioner shall not commit any offence while on bail.
(5) Petitioner shall not directly or indirectly make any
inducement, threat or promise to any person acquainted
with the facts of the case so as to dissuade them from
disclosing such facts to the court or to any police officer or
tamper with evidence.
(6) Petitioner shall appear before the Investigating Officer as
and when required by the Investigating Officer.
(7) Petitioner shall fully co-operate with the investigation.
In case of any violation of the above conditions or misuse of liberty, the
prosecution or the defacto complainant is at liberty to approach jurisdictional
court for cancellation of bail.
